intro: [WRONG START] S-tevia anisostemma var. wagneri, commonly known as Wagner's stevia, is a species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its use in traditional medicine, where its leaves are used to make herbal teas. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has potential applications in natural sweeteners and medicinal compounds.
